metadata.title: CVE-2017-5839 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The gst_riff_create_audio_caps function in gst-libs/gst/riff/riff-media.cin gst-plugins-base in GStreamer before 1.10.3 does not properly limitrecursion, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(stack overflow and crash) via vectors involving nested WAVEFORMATEX.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gst-plugins-base-1.0 - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-alsa - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-plugins-base-apps - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
gstreamer1.0-x - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
libgstreamer-plugins-base1.0-0 - 1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-base1.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.3-1ubuntu0.2').
